critique: This document primarily concerns the transfer of statistical policy functions from the Office of Management and Budget to the Secretary of Commerce. It establishes a Statistical Policy Coordination Committee and outlines the responsibilities of various government officials and agencies in relation to statistical services. Due to its focus on governmental organization and statistical policy, the document does not directly address issues related to ideological tilt, immigration, executive power, federalism, security vs. liberty, economic regulation, or social inclusion. Therefore, most scores are neutral.
